headline: Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) Announces CEO Transition With Joseph E. Creed Succeeding Umpleby
summary: Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) recently announced a significant executive leadership change, with Joseph E. Creed appointed as the new CEO effective May 1, 2025. This leadership transition, along with adjustments to executive compensation, appears timely with the company's stock seeing a 6% rise last week. This move aligned closely with broader market trends where major indexes were buoyed by tech and bank stocks amid easing U.S.-China trade tensions. Within this context, Caterpillar's announcements...

headline: Palantir, Caterpillar, HPE: Trending Tickers
summary: Madison Mills takes a closer look at some of the trending tickers of the trading day. Palantir (PLTR) is in focus after NATO bought its Maven Smart System. Caterpillar's (CAT) CEO, James Umpleby, will step down with COO Joe Creed taking his place on May 1. Activist investor Elliott Management builds a $1.5 billion stake in HPE (HPE), according to Bloomberg reports. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Caterpillar Changes CEOs, With COO Creed Taking Over
summary: Caterpillar has decided to make a change at the top, replacing Jim Umpleby with Joe Creed.

raw.headline: Caterpillar Changes CEOs, With COO Creed Taking Over
raw.summary: Caterpillar has decided to make a change at the top, replacing Jim Umpleby with Joe Creed.

headline: Caterpillar names insider Joe Creed as successor to CEO Umpleby
summary: (Reuters) -Caterpillar said on Tuesday that Chief Operating Officer Joe Creed would succeed Jim Umpleby as CEO, tapping an insider to help the construction equipment maker navigate the fallout of President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs.  Umpleby, a veteran who has been with the company for more than four decades, held the top job for the last eight years and guided the firm through a demand and supply chain downturn brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic.  Umpleby, who will transition to executive chairman, will hand over the reins on May 1 to 49-year-old Joseph Creed, a 28-year veteran with extensive leadership experience at Caterpillar.

raw.headline: Caterpillar names insider Joe Creed as successor to CEO Umpleby

Umpleby, a veteran who has been with the company for more than four decades, held the top job for the last eight years and guided the firm through a demand and supply chain downturn brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic.  Umpleby, who will transition to executive chairman, will hand over the reins on May 1 to 49-year-old Joseph Creed, a 28-year veteran with extensive leadership experience at Caterpillar.

headline: Caterpillar Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby to become Executive Chairman; Caterpillar Chief Operating Officer Joe Creed Elected as Caterpillar's Next CEO
summary: After eight years as CEO and nearly 45 years of service, Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE: CAT) Chairman and CEO D. James Umpleby III will become Executive Chairman of the Board effective May 1. Chief Operating Officer (COO) Joseph E. Creed, a 28-year Caterpillar veteran, will succeed him as CEO and join the Board of Directors May 1.
